trustfund: TF037958-ARGENTINA - MODEL COURT DEVELOPMENT,TF035229-ARGENTINA - JUDICIAL REFORM PROJECT,TF035228-ARGENTINA - JUDICIAL REFORM PROJECT,TF035127-ARGENTINA - JUDICIAL REFORM

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Model Court
            Development Project in Argentina is to identify, establish,
            and evaluate conditions supporting the realization of
            judicial administrative reform and eventually forming part
            of an overall legal reform program. The project's
            components are three. The first, Court Management, reviews
            the organization and court and case management of the
            seventeen model courts. It has two subcomponents. The first
            develops administration policies and strategies between the
            different levels of the judiciary; finalizes the court
            management plan and prepares studies; and designs case
            management procedures incorporating operational standards
            and statistics which verify and control changes being
            implemented. The second subcomponent develops a permanent
            solution to reduce the number of pending cases within the
            selected courts. The second component improves the skill
            levels within the court system for both judges and court
            personnel in court administration and case management by
            developing an education policy and training judges and court
            personnel. The third component comprises outreach activities
            and a number of reviews to evaluate the results of the model
            courts by creating judicial information centers, conducting
            user opinion surveys, disseminating information to the
            public, and evaluating the project.
